page.title: 08Llamas
page.content: Mrs.Robinson of{Hulam Farm}owns 3 {Llamas},a male, a female and a young male.A new baby is expected in{June. One Llama is a chestnut colour, the other two a creamy brown.They have long necks, pointed ears and a camel like face. In{Winter}they are fed on hay, in {Summer}they eat grass. The Llama hair is cut once every two years. Mrs.Robinson sends the hair to be washed and spun. The{'wool'}is rather like course mohair, but it is softer when mixed with Shetland wool. Llamas would be better to keep than sheep if they did not spit or bite because they do not get foot rot.
